intro: Lotononis dissitinodis, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant features velvety, heart-shaped leaves and produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers indirect sunlight, making it a popular houseplant. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its ability to bloom throughout the year under proper care.
